channel.title: RspsApp
channel.description:
I guess I should post it in this section since it has something to do with rsps'
When this reaches a releasable state, I'll put it in the download section. Right now it is only able to receive the server chat and display it. When my exams are finished I'll continue my work on this again, that would be in about a week!
[img]http://s27.postimg.org/jk3h64802/rsapp.jpg[/img] [img]https://fbcdn-sphotos-a-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/10624799_10205195736351847_4647292144547368926_n.jpg?oh=da2d719136f8698c77780801a213b66b&oe=54EBF79B&__gda__=1423145613_940458cebd55ebc74f32db63fdf5f888[/img]

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“Snow_, post:11, topic:547638”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=666544.msg4456604#msg4456604 date=1415271486]
This looks pretty cool. You should add a login system to it and buttons like kick and ban for admins. Really nice so far.
[/quote]
Such commands are coming! I’m not quite sure what you mean with ‘login system’ though? Do you mean the app-user should enter an administrative password, configured server-sided, so the app couldn’t be used by someone else?[/quote]No i mean have the user log in with their in game name and password so if they yell their name pops up and they have their proper rights on the app too.

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

If it’s a management application and no user-based authentication is set in place. You should look in to using Google’s authenticator to pair with the server. That way you don’t have to worry about anyone snooping on your server since you aren’t using any form of authentication.

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:12, topic:547638”][quote author=Snow_ link=topic=666544.msg4456606#msg4456606 date=1415272812]

I always liked what Whackatre done with PR and the IRC integration. Basically anyone with voice could use the command !yell and type a message after it and it’d appear using the servers yell system. It was more used for trolling iirc but it had good intentions I’m sure. Maybe you could include this in some kind of on the go app that relayed a certain clan chat and yell to an app and the app could contact the yell and said clan chat? It’d be a nice new features for users

If I understand correctly you say I should implement a yell and clanchat command on the app, which outputs the message to the yell / clanchat channel in the game? My native language isn’t English, that’s why I’m not sure I understood your post completely

[/quote]
Yes. Both the yell and clanchat channel should be displayed on the app as well, allowing users to communicate on the go.[/quote]
That would assume he’s logging in and authorizing the user via the server.
And would also assume he’s making this app so players could use.
If it’s a management app (like for him only), don’ think all that functionality is need.

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

Just copy half of Jagex’s RS Companion app and make it for your server. Yolo

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Snow_, post:11, topic:547638”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=666544.msg4456600#msg4456600 date=1415270345]
I always liked what Whackatre done with PR and the IRC integration. Basically anyone with voice could use the command !yell and type a message after it and it’d appear using the servers yell system. It was more used for trolling iirc but it had good intentions I’m sure. Maybe you could include this in some kind of on the go app that relayed a certain clan chat and yell to an app and the app could contact the yell and said clan chat? It’d be a nice new features for users
[/quote]
If I understand correctly you say I should implement a yell and clanchat command on the app, which outputs the message to the yell / clanchat channel in the game? My native language isn’t English, that’s why I’m not sure I understood your post completely :p[/quote]
Yes. Both the yell and clanchat channel should be displayed on the app as well, allowing users to communicate on the go.

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

Ruby:

I always liked what Whackatre done with PR and the IRC integration. Basically anyone with voice could use the command !yell and type a message after it and it’d appear using the servers yell system. It was more used for trolling iirc but it had good intentions I’m sure. Maybe you could include this in some kind of on the go app that relayed a certain clan chat and yell to an app and the app could contact the yell and said clan chat? It’d be a nice new features for users

If I understand correctly you say I should implement a yell and clanchat command on the app, which outputs the message to the yell / clanchat channel in the game? My native language isn’t English, that’s why I’m not sure I understood your post completely

whattehp406:

This looks pretty cool. You should add a login system to it and buttons like kick and ban for admins. Really nice so far.

Such commands are coming! I’m not quite sure what you mean with ‘login system’ though? Do you mean the app-user should enter an administrative password, configured server-sided, so the app couldn’t be used by someone else?

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I always liked what Whackatre done with PR and the IRC integration. Basically anyone with voice could use the command !yell and type a message after it and it’d appear using the servers yell system. It was more used for trolling iirc but it had good intentions I’m sure. Maybe you could include this in some kind of on the go app that relayed a certain clan chat and yell to an app and the app could contact the yell and said clan chat? It’d be a nice new features for users

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:547638”][quote author=lare69 link=topic=666544.msg4456553#msg4456553 date=1415243701]
so like… how is this useful?
[/quote]
The other one allowed you to send server messages, and manage the server. It even had some commands in the app. I’m sure in time Snow_ could add those features.
Could even add like a restart button and etc to manage the server when not at home. Maybe setup an alert when the server is down.[/quote]
Indeed, I’m developing this as I learn new (networking and android) stuff, when it’s finished I’ll add a few example-commands so that if anyone actually wants to use this, they know how too!

  • I’m doing this project mostly because I like doing it, not for the resulting app to be used
Vain_:

Suggestion: remove the server details from the main scene. Put this in a settings scene.

Thanks for the suggestion, will do this! (:

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

Suggestion: remove the server details from the main scene. Put this in a settings scene.

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

lare69:

so like… how is this useful?

The other one allowed you to send server messages, and manage the server. It even had some commands in the app. I’m sure in time Snow_ could add those features.
Could even add like a restart button and etc to manage the server when not at home. Maybe setup an alert when the server is down.

Read full topic

item.title: RspsApp
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

nolan2131:

This is cool, something different to look at. Continue development!

Thanks, will do!

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:547638”]Not to be that guy but this has been done before…
Good work nonetheless.[/quote]
I know, but I’m rather new to networking in general so I’m just doing this to ‘teach’ myself.

Read full topic
